description: From Middle English cumfiria, from Latin (herba) cōnfirma in Pseudo-Apuleius, also called cōnsolida, cōnserva, cōnferva, from conferveo (“to boil together”); from the use of the plant in tea to aid in healing bones.

entries.meaning: Any of several species of perennial herbs of the genus Symphytum, often specifically Symphytum officinale.
